If o'er the turf no trophy column rears</br>Sepulchral vase, no eulogy displays</br>Pride, silly fabling, o'er the full of years—</br>The early gone — who musingly surveys</br>This little mound, while mingled gems arrays</br>The mossy covert, as rude briar creeps</br>In bondage drear, finds sacred Truth pourtrays,</br>Unveil'd, 'tis home! — and gentle Pity weeps,</br>Ennobling the lone spot where kindred virtue sleeps.</br>
